title: Can a JuJu-less USC do it again? Is UConn ready to win it all? Previewing an Elite Eight showdown
content: It's not the superstar matchup fans expected. But the stakes of Monday's UConn-USC game are still sky high.

title: Braves' Profar gets 80-game ban for PED violation
content: Atlanta Braves outfielder Jurickson Profar was suspended for 80 games by Major League Baseball on Monday following a positive test for the performance-enhancing drug chorionic gonadotrophin.

title: Browns' Haslam: 'Big swing-and-miss' on Watson
content: Browns co-owner Jimmy Haslam said the team "took a big swing-and-miss" in acquiring QB Deshaun Watson and signing him to a $230 million deal that was fully guaranteed.

title: Harper, projected No. 2 pick, declares for draft
content: Rutgers freshman Dylan Harper, the projected No. 2 pick in the 2025 NBA draft, announced on ESPN's "NBA Today" on Monday that he will declare for the draft.

title: Sources: Tucker to sign 2-year deal with Knicks
content: After signing P.J. Tucker to two 10-day contracts, the New York Knicks plan to sign the forward to a two-year deal, sources told ESPN

title: NFL shortens time needed for Thursday night flex
content: NFL owners on Monday approved flexing Sunday games to Thursday night with 21 days' notice. Previously, 28 days' notice was needed.

title: Hawks' Young named asst. GM for Sooners hoops
content: Hawks star Trae Young has been named assistant GM for Oklahoma men's basketball and will assist with the evaluation of high school and transfer portal prospects.

title: Sources: St. John's lands top-10 transfer Hopkins
content: St. John's has landed top-10 transfer Bryce Hopkins, sources told ESPN's Jeff Borzello. Hopkins, a forward, played the past three seasons at Providence.

title: Ex-NFL DB Sherman's house robbed, family home
content: Retired NFL start defensive back Richard Sherman said Monday on X that robbers with guns hit his house over the weekend while his family was at home. He posted security photos and a video, asking for help in finding the perpetrators.

title: An MIT-educated professor, the New York Yankees and the bat that could be changing baseball
content: After the Yankees' home run barrage with bats that look like bowling pins, the innovation is sweeping baseball.

title: Our annual mock draft with 32 first-round trades: Deals for Kirk Cousins, Micah Parsons
content: We proposed 32 trades to shake up Round 1, including deals that involve Falcons QB Kirk Cousins and Cowboys edge Micah Parsons.

content: Here's how each 1-seed reached San Antonio and their key to reaching the final, plus disagreement on one game.

content: Chiles always knew she could help the Bruins win an NCAA title, but she didn't know how much they would help her heal.

title: Haaland's nightmare game, Napoli back in Serie A title race, RB Leipzig chaos, more

title: Isco on Antony: We need to crowdfund for him
content: Real Betis midfielder Isco has joked that crowdfunding will be needed to keep Manchester United's loanee Antony at the club for at least next season.

title: City hopeful injury won't end Haaland's season
content: Erling Haaland is set for a spell on the sideline with an ankle injury picked up against Bournemouth on Sunday, but Manchester City remain hopeful the striker will be able to play again this season and take part in the FIFA Club World Cup this summer.

title: Wrexham revenue up 155% amid promotion push
content: Wrexham reported record financial results for their first year back in the EFL in the latest chapter of the club's success story.

title: Davidson out of USWNT squad with knee injury
content: Defender Tierna Davidson will miss the United States women's national team's upcoming pair of games against Brazil due to a knee injury, U.S. Soccer announced on Monday.

title: Sporting KC, Vermes part ways after 16 years
content: Sporting Kansas City have have parted ways with manager Peter Vermes the Major League Soccer club announced on Monday.

title: Arsenal and Spurs to play first NLD overseas
content: Tottenham Hotspur and Arsenal will face off in Hong Kong in July for what will be the first north London derby to take place outside of the UK.

title: Levy on Spurs transfers: We won't overspend
content: Tottenham Hotspur chairman Daniel Levy has defended the team's transfer spending and described the 2024-25 season as "highly challenging."

title: Amorim: Maguire, Yoro set for Man Utd return
content: Ruben Amorim has offered a positive fitness update with Harry Maguire and Leny Yoro available to play against Nottingham Forest on Tuesday.

title: Justine Siegal will go to bat for women in pro baseball once more as WPBL co-founder
content: As part of Women's History Month, ESPN examines WPBL co-founder Justine Siegal's lifelong dedication to women's baseball.

title: NHL playoff watch: The Stars' path to the Central title
content: Dallas will need some help, but Winnipeg is vulnerable. Plus, projections for the entire playoff bracket.

title: MLS: Messi's Miami on top, Sporting KC rock bottom
content: A 35-minute cameo from Leo Messi was all Inter Miami needed to show why they are clear atop ESPN's MLS Power Rankings. Sporting KC's season, meanwhile, went from bad to worse.

title: NWSL: Orlando stays top, Angel City on the up
content: Orlando is still top of ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings, but Angel City is beginning to look like a contender.

title: Letting Salah leave for free could be one of Liverpool's biggest mistakes ever
content: Every time Mohamed Salah scores, he gets closer to Erling Haaland's record, and Liverpool's failure to hand him a new contract looks even more reckless.

content: Everything you need to know about the 2025 McDonald's All American girls' game on Tuesday (6:30 p.m. ET, ESPN2).

content: With less than a year until the Olympics, the world titles from Ilia Malinin, Alysa Liu and Madison Chock and Evan Bates have even more weight.

title: 'The Big Match': Arsenal FC to host club-themed dating show
content: The club is calling for single supporters based out of the United Kingdom and over the age of 18 to apply to be a participant in the show.

title: Forecasting next season for women's eliminated top seeds
content: NC State has been eliminated. From portal priorities to incoming recruits, we look ahead to the Wolfpack next season.

title: Did Boeing "Screw Up"? Sunita Williams And Butch Wilmore Say...
content: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore thanked US President Donald Trump and SpaceX owner Elon Musk for their help in bringing them back from the International Space Station (ISS), where they stayed on for nine months.

title: 'Will You Return To Space On Boeing Starliner?' What NASA Astronauts Said
content: NASA Crew-9 astronauts Sunita Williams, Butch Wilmore and Nick Hague spoke to the press today about the future of human space flight programme, after their recent return from the International Space Station (ISS).

title: Bangladesh Asks For China's "Extension" In Veiled Threat To Northeast India
content: Bangladesh's interim government adviser Muhammad Yunus has tried to jab New Delhi by issuing a veiled threat to India's northeastern states while appealing to China to "extend" in the region.

title: 'Going To An Address Where...': Kunal Kamra's Swipe As Cops Visit Mumbai Home
content: Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra on Monday took a swipe at the Mumbai Police, asking them not to "waste time" and "public resources".

title: HAL Didn't Transfer Sensitive Tech To Russia: Sources On NYT Report
content: ANew York Times report wrongly claimed thatHindustan Aeronautics Limited - a government-owned aerospace and defence company - sold sensitive technology, with potential military use, to a blacklisted agency supplying Russia with weapons.

title: Car Driven By 15-Year-Old Crushes Toddler, Delhi Family's Eid Turns Tragic
content: Eid excitement at a Delhi home turned to mourning after their two-year-old daughter was crushed to death while she was playing on the street outside their home. The Hyundai Venue car was driven by a 15-year-old.

title: 4 Chinese Men Try To "Remove" Documents From Bangkok Collapse Site, Detained
content: Police in Thailand detained four Chinese nationals on Sunday for unlawfully entering the site of an under-construction building that collapsed after a powerful earthquake in Chatuchak District last week.

title: Live: India Sends Fresh Batch Of Relief Aid To Myanmar As Over 2,000 Dead
content: The ruling junta in Myanmar on Monday declared a week of national mourning for the devastating earthquake, which has killed more than 1,700 people so far.

title: Bumrah "On Borderline Of A Fracture": BCCI Sent 'You Can't Do That' Message
content: Jasprit Bumrah missed the India vs England series, the Champions Trophy and there is still no clarity on when he will be back in IPL 2025 for Mumbai Indians

title: India, US To Jointly Design, Manufacture Nuclear Reactors In India
content: In a landmark moment for the India-US civil nuclear deal, which was signed two decades ago, the US' Department of Energy or DoE has given the final approval permitting a US company to jointly design and build nuclear power plants in India.

title: Nidhi Tewari, IFS Officer From PM's Constituency, His New Private Secretary
content: Nidhi Tewari, a 2014-batch officer of the Indian Foreign Service, will take over as the next private secretary of  Prime Minister Narendra Modi. She is currently serving as the Deputy Secretary in the Prime Minister's Office or PMO

title: Jaish And Lashkar Rift Widens, India Reworks Strategy Amid Changed Dynamics
content: Pakistani state actors are pushing battle-hardened terrorists of the Jaish-e-Mohammed into India from several areas in Jammu and Kashmir, sources told NDTV.

title: IPL 2025: Ashwani Kumar Excels On Debut As MI Beat KKR To Register 1st Win
content: Mumbai Indians vs Kolkata Knight Riders Highlights, IPL 2025: MI notched up their first win, soaring up to sixth, while KKR sank to the bottom of the IPL table.

title: "Our Father...": D Fadnavis Snaps At Sanjay Raut For PM 'Retirement' Talk
content: There is no chance that Prime Minister Modi will retire in September, Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said Monday, amid buzz over the BJP's 'unspoken rule' about 75 being the retirement age.

title: Opinion: Turkey: History Comes Back To Bite Erdogan
content: In 1998, while still mayor of Istanbul, Erdogan was arrested on charges of inciting racial hatred and spent four months in jail. His arrest only made him more popular and brought him to the national stage.

title: Donald Trump Says US Will Tariff The Entire World, "Let's See What Happens"
content: Donald Trump declared that he will tariff the entire world, as US gears up for what he has called "Liberation Day" on April 2. His announcement came aboard the Air Force One. In the coming days, we would impose tariffs on "all countries," he said.

title: Four children among seven killed in gas cylinder blast in Bengal
content: A probe would also be conducted to ascertain whether firecrackers were manufactured inside the house, another officer said

title: BMTC to operate special buses for IPL 2025 matches at Chinnaswamy Stadium
content: To accommodate the surge in demand, BMTC will deploy buses on multiple routes connecting key areas of the city with the stadium.

title: Eid in Bhopal marked by black bands against Waqf Bill, Palestine placards
content: At the Bhopal Idgah, several people sported black arm bands during the morning prayers against the Waqf Amendment Bill 2024, while videos on social media showed groups of people showcasing placards in support of Palestine.

title: Thinking beyond population count
content: The time has come to go beyond population size as the lone yardstick of allocation and determination of political representation

title: Bangladesh inviting China dangerous for Northeast region, says Congress
content: Pawan Khera shared a video clip of Bangladesh Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus where he claimed that Bangladesh is the guardian of the ocean (Bay of Bengal)

title: Ujjain, Omkareshwar, Maihar among Madhya Pradesh’s religious cities to face liquor ban from April 1
content: While announcing the ban, Mr. Yadav said his government has taken a historic step towards de-addiction and cited "public faith and religious reverence" associated with these cities and rural areas as reasons for the move

title: Ministers threaten Kunal Kamra over remarks on Eknath Shinde, alleges Sanjay Raut
content: Mr. Raut claimed that ‘Ministers in the State Cabinet are openly threatening Kunal Kamra, despite such lawlessness, Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis remains a mute spectator.’

title: Study reveals rainfall increase in Western Ghats over 800 years
content: Experts stress the importance of long-term environmental policies to mitigate risks from intensifying monsoon

title: Delhi High Court upholds disability pension order for two Army personnel
content: Court recalls former U.S. President Kennedy’s ‘stirring words’ on patriotism that while ‘we sip our hot cappuccinos by the fireplace, soldiers are braving icy winds at the border’

title: Ahead of SC hearing, Adivasi rights bodies, environmentalists ask Tribal Affairs Ministry to defend Forest Rights Act
content: Excessive reliance on satellite imagery, without abiding by the list of evidence provided in the FRA, had led to ‘wrongful denials of rightful claims’, the tribal rights bodies said

title: Panchakarma technician course launched at Snigdha Ayurvedic Hospital
content: Health Minister Satya Kumar Yadav inaugurates praises Ayurveda’s growth, and urges stronger government support

title: Two-day Congress session in Gujarat will seek to highlight the party’s ‘rich legacy’ in State
content: AICC session in Gujarat to highlight Congress legacy with CWC meeting at Sardar Patel memorial and Sabarmati Ashram visit

title: Contrary to regulations, SC/ST PG medical students pay up tuition fees, get no refund even after completing course
content: Affected doctors said when they raised the issue with their respective college administrations, they were told there was no official word from the DME on fee exemption/refund.

title: El Nino ruled out during monsoon this year: IMD
content: Before the monsoons kick in, however, India will be reeling in ‘above normal’ temperatures during the summer months; there could be more heatwave days this year, says the IMD

title: Ram Navami posters with pictures of Modi, Suvendu Adhikari surface in Kolkata on Id
content: This development follows a series of public statements by BJP leaders in West Bengal this month urging Hindus to come out in large numbers and celebrate Ram Navami on a large scale

title: NEP promotes Indianisation of education system, Sonia should support it: Fadnavis
content: Responding to Sonia Gandhi’s opinion piece titled, ‘The ‘3Cs’ that haunt Indian education today‘ published on The Hindu, Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said the New Education Policy is all about Indianisation of Indian education system.

title: Opposition misleading Muslims on Waqf Bill: Rijiju
content: With the Centre likely to table the Amendment Bill on April 2, the Minister accused the Opposition of misleading ‘innocent Muslims’ by telling them that the government will ‘snatch’ their properties

title: Uttarakhand renames 18 places located in Haridwar, Dehradun, Nainital, Udham Singh Nagar districts
content: Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami says the move is to respect public sentiment and preserve Indian culture and heritage

title: Parliamentary panel expresses concern over ‘chronic’ fund underutilisation by Tourism Ministry
content: Ministry used only ₹396 crore of the ₹2,479 crore allocated in 2024-25; Alarming statistics indicate deep-rooted systemic inefficiencies, says parliamentary committee in report submitted to Rajya Sabha

title: India-U.S. tri-service Ex Tiger Triumph to be held from April 1 to April 13
content: The exercise, involving Army, Navy, and Airforce forces of both countires, aims to enhance interoperability for conducting Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief.

title: New e-pass system in the Nilgiris, Kodaikanal from today; confusion still reigns over its implementation
content: The system will remain in force till June 30.  The online link for travellers to register themselves for e-passes was unveiled on Monday. The High Court has mandated that vehicles using non-polluting fuels be given priority in the grant of e-passes

title: CPI(M) to engage with the youth in residential areas, cultural spheres
content: The political-organisational report of the party acknowledges “failure in reaching out sufficiently to the youth” and proposes to organise activities for students and the youth in residential areas, sports arenas and cultural spaces, including libraries.

title: Excise registers 338 NDPS cases in Ernakulam in first quarter of 2025
content: A total of 335 arrests recorded in Ernakulam in the first three months of the year; department conducted 3,757 raids, including 48 joint operations with police and Customs, and checked 6,528 vehicles

title: Voluntary return of undocumented migrants at Bangladesh border increased after government crackdown, say officials
content: In December 2024, the MHA wrote to all States to identify and deport undocumented Bangladeshi migrants, and drives were conducted in several States

title: BJP, Trinamool using Eid and Ram Navami festivities to promote violence, hatred: WB CPI(M)
content: CPI(M) State secretary calls for religious unity and urges religious people to not let political parties hijack their festivals for political gain

title: Pawan Kalyan is putting special focus on development of North Andhra, says Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar
content: ‘The Deputy Chief Minister is keen on initiating a skill development programme to suit the needs of the industry in the region’

title: Union Minister Pemmmasani assures resolution of BSNL service disruptions
content: He contacted BSNL Chief General Manager Seshachalam over the phone and sought an explanation regarding the issues raised by TIP operators, including persistent disruptions in BSNL’s broadband services, speed issues, transmission interruptions, and billing problems

title: Government organ transplant and retrieval centre to be established in Bengaluru
content: ₹ 1 crore sanctioned for facility development and establishment, steps taken to construct a helipad at Victoria Hospital for seamless organ transportation.

content: We have already discussed about the Waqf Amendment Bill with Chief Minister and we will speak to him once again, says A.P. Waqf Board Chairman

title: Bengal BJP accuses Mamata of insulting Hindu religion during Id celebrations
content: Addressing a gathering in Kolkata, the Chief Minister said, ‘I don’t support the (Ganda Dharm - dirty religion) which this jumla party had created’

title: A.P. government committed to development of minorities, say ministers
content: In the latest Budget, ₹5,434 crore has been allocated for minority welfare and ₹14 crore for Haj pilgrimage, says Social Welfare Minister Dola Sree Bala Veeranjaneya Swamy

title: Modern slaughterhouse to open in capital city within a month
content: The city Corporation’s slaughterhouse at Kunnukuzhy was closed in February 2013 as it failed to manage the waste generated in a scientific way. In the absence of a slaughterhouse, illegal abattoirs have flourished across the city

title: Traitor jibe at Shinde: Mumbai cops reach Kunal Kamra's Mahim home as he fails to appear
content: Responding to the news, Mr. Kamra took to the social media platform X and called Mumbai cops’ efforts a “waste of time and public resources”

title: Prayers, silent protests mark Eid-ul-Fitr celebrations in Vijayawada
content: Many arrive for Eid prayers sporting black ribbons as per call given by All India Muslim Personal Law Board as a protest against the Waqf (Amendment) Bill

title: Faced with flak, tourism and civic agencies attempt to restore Fort Kochi beach to its past glory
content: Corporation mulls a floating boom barrier that protrudes into the sea to prevent the deposit of trash and seaweed on the beach, says Mayor M. Anilkumar

title: CBCI appeals to political parties to adopt an unbiased approach towards Waqf Bill
content: It says certain provisions in the existing Central Waqf Act are inconsistent with the Constitution. The rightful ownership of land must be fully restored to the people of Munambam, the forum adds

title: Kodandarama taken out on palanquin, rides Garuda on fifth day of Brahmotsavams
content: The temple is also gearing up for the annual ‘Srirama Navami’ festivities which will be held from April 6 to 8

title: Customised circuits planned to boost tourism potential of Kozhikode
content: A waterway will be constructed from Elathur to Kadalundi, connecting various rivers and canals. Circuit stations will be set up at Beypore, Kothi, Kallai, Sarovaram Biopark, Elathur, and Korapuzha, where water taxi services will be available

title: M.P. govt ‘lied’ about no hike in taxes during Budget, says Congress
content: Party leader Patwari points to the iminent rise in power tariff and the likely increase in property rates and taxes as proof of the government’s ‘lies’

title: CPI casts doubt on Tharoor’s political loyalties following Congress leader’s praise of Modi’s global health diplomacy during COVID-19
content: In an article published in an English news weekly on the eve of the fifth anniversary of the national lockdown, Mr Tharoor projected the Central government’s decision to supply two major COVID-19 vaccines produced in the country to 100 nations as a master stroke of global health diplomacy.

title: 2.65 lakh beneficiaries to receive NTR Bharosa pensions in Chittoor district
content: 100 per cent of the pension disbursement must be completed on the opening day without any delay, says Collector

title: Trial run of portable traffic control light successful in Kozhikode
content: The product was brought to the city after a successful trial run by Nagpur police; the solar-powered unit costs around ₹2.10 lakh

title: Former PCCF appeals to CM to stop grant of land within swampy grasslands in Nagarahole core area to claimants
content: Former forest official B.K. Singh any such action will lead to serious human-wildlife conflict in Virajpet taluk

title: Delhi HC relief to HIV-positive men in promotion, appointment in paramilitary forces
content: The High Court mandates reasonable accommodation for HIV-positive individuals in employment, protecting against discrimination

title: Vijayawada roundtable calls for special Assembly session, all-party meet on delimitation
content: Speakers urge the Chief Minister to pass a resolution on the issue after holding a thorough debate and send it to the Centre; Andhra Pradesh, along with other Southern States, would lose Lok Sabha seats if the proposed delimitation is implemented, they warn; roundtable calls upon TDP, JSP, and YSRCP to attend the upcoming  conference on delimitation in Hyderabad

content: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad K. Sangma said it was unfortunate that Nongthombam Biren Singh dragged the name of his father

content: With multiple cost increases coming into effect simultaneously, the financial burden on consumers is expected to rise significantly impacting household budgets across Karnataka.

title: Jagan condemns ‘murder’ of YSRCP worker in Sri Sathya Sai district
content: The former Chief Minister alleges deterioration of law and order in Andhra Pradesh and blames the TDP for it

title: Lowering tariff will harm farmers: Samyukt Kisan Morcha
content: The farmers’ body said it would strongly respond to efforts to open the Indian market to products from the United States

title: CNG to cost more after govt hikes APM gas price by 4%
content: This is the first increase in the APM gas price in two years and in accordance with the roadmap that was laid out by the government

title: Congress eyes revival in Srikakulam, seeks candidate names for ZPTC, MPTC polls
content: Congress leader Ambati Krishnarao vows party revival in Srikakulam, focusing on local issues and selecting candidates for ZPTC and MPTC polls

title: A.P. government committed to welfare of minorities, says Minister
content: Mandipalli Ramprasad Reddy asks Hindus and Muslims to uphold their spirit of brotherhood and maintain Rayachoti’s ageless reputation for communal peace and harmony

title: Illegal parking at Bengaluru bus stops continues with over 23,000 cases booked in three years
content: Regular commuters say that the illegal occupation of bus stops forces BMTC buses to stop in the middle of the road, delaying traffic and creating safety hazards

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern Munich's Thomas Müller has offers from MLS
content: former german international has received offers from clubs in MLS . he is out of contract at the end of the season and talks are ongoing over a new one-year deal . but it looks as though he will be leaving the club where he has spent his entire practising .

title: Countdown to 894: The Alex Ovechkin goal-scoring tracker
content: Alex Ovechkin broke 800-goal barrier during 2022-23 season . he now has 890 goals and is one of the NHL's most popular bets . the date when Ovi eclipses Gretzky depends on his goal-scoring pace .

title: College baseball Week 7: Top 25 rankings, SEC curfew and what to watch
content: Coastal Carolina, Kansas State and Arizona State are the newcomers to this week's rankings and take the spots of Wake Forest, Stanford and Arias . the rest of the top five mostly looks the same as last week, but Texas has rose to the no. 5 spot as Oregon State dropped completely to no. 11 .

title: European soccer review: Barcelona extend unbeaten run to 20
content: barcelona remain unbeaten in 2025 after 20 games without recording a loss this year under Hansi Flick . real madrid are now two games away from winning the oldest competition in the world . marco rose is out of a job at RB Leipzig with Zsolt Lw coming in .

title: Can Arsenal, Man United make a WSL title race after Chelsea stumble?
content: arsenal beat real madrid 2-1 in the women's champions league . a second-half brace from Ana Azkona handed athletic club a win over deportivo La Corua after fellow basque side Eibar had triumphed over Levante .

title: Kadammanitta Foundation award presented to M. Leelavathy
content: health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: US Secret Service nixed Pannun plan to serve Ajit Doval summons
content: A US court dismissed Gurpatwant Singh Pannun's claim of delivering a summons to NSA Ajit Doval during PM Modi's US visit. The court confirmed the summons wasn't served properly as required, aligning with India's stance. The incident involved attempted delivery by process servers which failed due to Secret Service intervention.

title: Nearly 20 years after N-deal, DoE clears US firm to build & design reactors in India
content: The US Department of Energy has granted regulatory clearance for Holtec International to transfer small modular reactor technology to India, partnering with Indian firms. This approval marks significant progress in the Indo-US Civil Nuclear Agreement, potentially leading to the construction of US-designed nuclear reactors in India.

title: 'Reckless, belligerent': Iran complains about Donald Trump's threat to UN
content: Iran has lodged a complaint with the United Nations Security Council, condemning US President Donald Trump’s threats of military action and describing them as a violation of international law. Iran warns it will respond decisively to any aggression. This follows Trump’s warning of severe bombing if Iran does not agree to a new nuclear deal.

title: Fresh encounter breaks out in J&K's Kathua, 3 terrorists trapped
content: A fresh encounter between terrorists and security forces erupted in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua, with three terrorists trapped. Following previous clashes that resulted in casualties, security forces have intensified search operations with aerial surveillance and sniffer dogs. Deputy Inspector General Shiv Kumar Sharma emphasized the commitment to the mission until the last terrorist is neutralized.

title: How to create Ghibli style art using Google Gemini for free
content: Ghibli style art has surged on social media, with users turning personal photos into the beloved aesthetic of Hayao Miyazaki's films using Google Gemini's AI. The process involves uploading a photo, crafting detailed prompts, and refining the generated image. This trend blends cutting-edge technology with the whimsical charm of Studio Ghibli's dreamy visuals.

title: Kunal Kamra show audience members served notices
content: Khar police visited comedian Kunal Kamra's Mahim home to investigate his remarks about Maharashtra deputy CM Eknath Shinde in a recent show. Kamra criticized this action as a waste of resources, and he currently resides in Puducherry. Police have begun recording statements from audience members.

title: Member of banned anti-Shia outfit ASWJ killed in targeted attack in Pakistan
content: Qari Abdul Rehman, a member of the banned anti-Shia outfit ASWJ, was killed in a targeted attack by masked assailants in Karachi's Qaid Abad. The incident, believed to be sectarian in nature, has heightened concerns over Pakistan's sectarian violence. The ASWJ condemned the act as terrorism.

title: Eid Mubarak 2025: 75+ Happy Eid-ul-Fitr messages, greetings, wishes and quotes
content: Eid-ul-Fitr marks the end of Ramadan and is celebrated by Muslims through prayer, charity, and feasting. Celebrations include wearing new clothes, family gatherings, special foods, and giving gifts to children. The festival symbolizes faith, purity, and togetherness and will be observed from March 31 to April 1, 2025, based on moon sighting.

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman calls Elon Musk's Twitter 'negative platform'
content: ChatGPT's Ghibli image generator has taken social media by storm, leading to increased user engagement and positivity online. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman expressed his delight at the positive response, despite earlier tensions with Elon Musk over OpenAI's direction and ownership restructuring.

title: Private hospitals' share in CGHS spend up from 24% to 60% in 4 years
content: Reimbursements to private hospitals under the Central Government Health Scheme (CGHS) have surged from 24% in 2019-20 to 60% in 2023-24. A significant rise in the number of beneficiaries has driven this increase. Instances of fraudulent billing and overcharging by empanelled hospitals have raised concerns about proper oversight and cost-effectiveness in the scheme.

title: India, US to kick off tri-service exercise in Bay of Bengal today
content: India and the US are set to begin their major tri-service exercise 'Tiger Triumph' in the Bay of Bengal, focusing on military interoperability for humanitarian assistance and disaster relief. The exercise includes operations at Visakhapatnam and Kakinada, with India deploying warships, aircraft, and troops, while the US contributes amphibious warships and marines.

title: EPFO eyes raising auto-settlement limit to Rs 5 lakh
content: EPFO is proposing to increase the auto settlement limit for its subscribers from Rs 1 lakh to Rs 5 lakh, pending approval by the central board of trustees. The organisation has already streamlined the claim process significantly, resulting in faster settlements and an expected record of over 6 crore settlements this year.

content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: White House to DOGE employees: Disable this feature of Signal app
content: The Trump White House directed Department of Government Efficiency employees to disable Signal's auto-delete feature to preserve records, following revelations of sensitive military information leaks. Officials mistakenly included an Atlantic reporter in the Signal chats discussing Yemen attack plans, prompting the new policy to ensure compliance with federal recordkeeping laws.

title: India junks NYT claim of HAL transferring sensitive tech to Russia
content: The Indian government has dismissed a New York Times report alleging Hindustan Aeronautics Limited's involvement in transferring sensitive British technology to Russia as inaccurate and misleading. Officials emphasize that the Indian entity adhered to all international trade obligations and laws, highlighting the need for reputable media to ensure accuracy before publication.

title: HIV+ status no ground to deny CAPF job or promotion: High court
content: The Delhi High Court ruled that individuals with HIV cannot be denied employment or promotion, emphasizing the obligation for 'reasonable accommodation.' It ordered the CAPF to review the cases of three personnel denied promotions or appointments due to their HIV status, stating such denials violate the HIV Act and are discriminatory.

title: Heritage structure razed to make way for Guwahati riverfront project
content: A historic colonial-era structure, Mahafezkhana, has been demolished by the Guwahati Metropolitan Development Authority to facilitate the Brahmaputra riverfront expansion. The heritage building, which withstood major earthquakes in 1897 and 1950, was demolished despite public outcry and suggestions for its preservation.

title: April-June likely to be hotter than usual across India: IMD
content: The upcoming April-June season is predicted to experience hotter than normal temperatures across most of India, with an increase in heatwave days. Vulnerable populations are at higher risk of heat-related illnesses, and anticipatory actions by local authorities are advised to mitigate potential impacts.

title: West Bengal: 7 killed, 1 injured in gas cylinder blast in South 24 Parganas
content: At least seven people, including four children and two women, lost their lives in a gas cylinder explosion in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district. The incident occurred in a house in Dholaghat village around 9 pm. Another woman sustained injuries and was taken to the hospital. Authorities believe firecrackers stored in the house ignited, causing the explosion.

title: In coastal outreach, CISF holds 6,500km cyclothon
content: CISF has initiated the 'Great Indian Coastal Cyclothon' to raise awareness about coastal security by engaging with coastal communities. The event concluded with 125 cyclists, including 14 women, covering 6,553 km over 25 days and connecting with 58 communities across 11 states and UTs, reaching a 2.5 crore-strong audience.

title: Land not available, Kashipur's historic horse market shuts down
content: The 170-year-old Nakhasa Bazaar in Kashipur, known for trading rare horse breeds, has been canceled due to land unavailability. The fair, established in 1855, has drawn traders from across India. This abrupt closure marks the end of an era for the region’s cultural and commercial heritage.

title: 3 lotion companies fail to prove 'skin whitening' claims, fined
content: E-commerce ads claiming instant skin whitening by lotions have been proven unsubstantiated, as companies admitted to exaggerating unique selling points to stand out online. The Central Consumer Protection Authority has fined these companies and warned of harsher penalties for future offences, emphasizing the illegality of misleading advertisements.

title: 2014-batch IFS officer Nidhi Tewari named private secretary to PM Modi
content: Nidhi Tewari, a 2014-batch Indian Foreign Service officer, has been appointed as private secretary to PM Narendra Modi. This marks a significant achievement as she becomes the first woman to secure this position in recent history, bringing valuable experience from her roles in the PMO and foreign ministry.

title: 'Moment of truth for Musk': Can Trump's auto tariffs save Tesla from BYD?
content: Trump’s 25% tariff on imported vehicles aids Tesla in the US but fails against China’s BYD, which leads global EV sales. Tesla faces backlash abroad due to Musk’s Trump affiliation, impacting its brand. Chinese EV competitors like BYD, XPeng, Nio are advancing rapidly. Future competition hinges not just on tariffs but technological and market dynamics.

title: Aurangzebpur to be renamed Shivaji Nagar, says Uttarakhand CM Dhami
content: Uttarakhand chief minister Pushkar Singh Dhami announced the renaming of 13 areas and two roads in four districts to reflect Indian culture and heritage. The changes include new names in Haridwar, Dehradun, Nainital, and Udham Singh Nagar, inspired by prominent Indian figures.

title: Ashwani's record-breaking debut powers MI to first win of IPL 2025
content: Mumbai Indians' pacer Ashwani Kumar impressed everyone with his 4/24 on an IPL debut, leading his team to an eight-wicket victory against Kolkata Knight Riders. Ashwani's performance was instrumental in bundling KKR out for 116, marking him as a promising future talent. KKR’s innings started on a disastrous note as Sunil Narine was bowled for a duck by Trent Boult in the very first over. The collapse continued when Quinton de Kock (1) followed in the next over, caught by Ashwani off Deepak Chahar.

title: Taking lessons from Money Heist, 6 loot gold from SBI branch in Karnataka
content: Five months after a bank burglary in Karnataka's Davanagere district, police have arrested six first-time offenders. The mastermind, Vijay Kumar from Madurai, extensively planned the heist by watching crime dramas and documentaries. Motivated by a rejected loan application, they looted 17.7kg of gold worth nearly Rs 16 crore.

title: Design, material? Thailand probes why Chinese-built tower collapsed in quake
content: Thai authorities are investigating the collapse of a 30-storey office tower in Bangkok after a powerful earthquake in Myanmar. The building's design, construction, and material standards are under scrutiny, with substandard steel possibly contributing to the disaster. Rescue operations continue as concerns over Thailand’s building safety regulations and emergency response system persist.

title: Tharoor jabs Congress yet again, praises PM Modi's vaccine diplomacy
content: Shashi Tharoor praises PM Modi for India's vaccine diplomacy  contrasting with past criticism from Congress leaders like Rahul and Sonia Gandhi. Tharoor's remarks have embarrassed his party, giving BJP an opportunity to mock Congress. BJP welcomes these acknowledgments of Modi's successful global initiatives.

title: MI create history, set IPL record for most wins against a team at one venue
content: Mumbai Indians made IPL history by becoming the first team to win 10 matches against a single opponent at one venue, defeating Kolkata Knight Riders at Wankhede Stadium. MI restricted KKR to 116 runs, with Ashwani Kumar taking four wickets. Ryan Rickelton and Suryakumar Yadav led the chase, securing an eight-wicket victory with over seven overs remaining.

title: Ashwani Kumar scripts history with record-breaking IPL debut for MI
content: Mumbai Indians' Ashwani Kumar had an incredible IPL debut, taking 4 for 24 against Kolkata Knight Riders, the best by an Indian on IPL debut. His efforts helped restrict KKR to the lowest total of this IPL season. The 23-year-old's outstanding performance, combined with Deepak Chahar's contribution, highlights his promising future.

title: 'Is Nasa to blame?' What Sunita, Butch said on delayed return from space
content: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore discussed their nine-month extended stay on the ISS due to technical issues with Boeing's Starliner spacecraft. They adapted to the situation, focusing on their mission, while their return was facilitated by NASA and SpaceX amid external political pressures.

title: 'I just had a banana ...': Ashwani reveals after record-breaking IPL debut
content: Mumbai Indians' 23-year-old debutant Ashwani Kumar had a stellar start to his IPL career, taking four wickets against Kolkata Knight Riders. Despite pre-match nerves, he delivered an impressive performance, helping bundle out KKR for 116. Kumar credited captain Hardik Pandya for strategic advice and expressed pride in his achievement. This was his first four-wicket haul in any format.

title: Peter Schrager’s surprise NFL network exit for ESPN
content: Peter Schrager, a popular figure from Good Morning Football, confirmed his departure from NFL Network with plans rumored towards joining ESPN. This move could be indicative of a significant media shift, particularly with whispers of ESPN potentially acquiring NFL Network. Schrager's expertise and presence make him a valuable asset for future NFL coverage.

title: On cam: Two-yr-old girl crushed under car being driven by teen in Delhi
content: A family's Eid celebration in Delhi turned tragic when their two-year-old daughter was fatally hit by a car driven by a neighbor's teenage son in Paharganj. The incident, captured on CCTV, showed the child being run over as the car moved forward hesitantly. The toddler was pronounced dead at a nearby medical facility.

title: Russia to rule on removing Taliban from 'terror' list after 20 years
content: Russia's Supreme Court is set to consider removing the Taliban from its terrorist organization list on April 17, following a recommendation from the prosecutor general's office. The move comes as Russia continues to engage diplomatically with the Taliban despite their terrorist classification since 2003.

title: Who is Ashwani Kumar? MI's debutant who took a wicket on first ball
content: Ashwani Kumar, a left-arm pacer for Mumbai Indians, had a memorable IPL debut by taking a wicket with his first ball against Kolkata Knight Riders. His breakthrough came with a spectacular catch by Tilak Varma. This early strike helped Mumbai Indians dominate the game. Ashwani, from Punjab, impressed in his eagerly anticipated debut.

title: Pakistan suffers deadliest Ramzan in a decade
content: During Ramzan, Pakistan saw its highest number of militant attacks in a decade, totaling 84 incidents compared to 26 last year, as reported by think tanks. The escalation follows the Pakistani Taliban's ceasefire withdrawal and the Baloch Liberation Army's increased activities.

title: 'Factually incorrect, misleading': India rejects NYT report on HAL
content: The ministry of external affairs in India has rejected a report by The New York Times as factually incorrect and misleading. The report alleged that Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) engaged in questionable transactions involving restricted technology with Russia, which the ministry denied, emphasizing India's compliance with strategic trade laws.

title: Rocket Companies to acquire Mr Cooper in $9.4 billion all-stock deal
content: Rocket Mortgage is set to acquire Mr. Cooper in an all-stock deal valued at $9.4 billion, soon after acquiring Redfin. The merger will handle one in six US mortgages, adding 7 million clients to Rocket's portfolio. Jay Bray will become President and CEO of the combined company, expected to boost loan volumes and reduce customer acquisition costs.
